Summary: Bright silent light travelling at an unusual speed
divs: sighting detailsi was standing outside my home on a calm night looking into a clear but dark sky for meteorite streaks. stars were fairly bright. from the east i saw a bright light approaching to the west from an approximate distance of 3 miles which i suspected to be an airplane or jet. it seemed to be moving at an unusually high speed. i am very familiar with standard aircraft speeds and the rates they progress through the air (at night). this above average bright white\yellow light approached and covered an amazing distance in a short time. it appeared to maintain an estimated steady altitude of about 1,000 to 2,000 feet. i do not recall any flashing red or green lights which are always active on airplanes flying at night. as it drew nearer to within 1\2mile?? i expected to hear its engine however it was completely silent at all times. normally an aircraft flying even twice that distance would have made a distinctly familiar loud sound. there was no wind or obscuring noise to mask any normal engine noise if it produced any. i began watching it more closely when i percieved the unusual speed and brightness of light. it travelled east to west for about 15 seconds then made a fairly gentle curve to the south but with no unusual maneuvers. i guestimate it's closest distance to me to be about 1\2 to 3\4 mile however perception at night can be tricky. i am very certain it was not a satellite or meteorite in the upper atmosphere. no way! it was relatively close. it went out of view as it passed behind some woods by my house. the entire event lasted approximately 45 seconds to 1 minute from when i first noticed it to when i lost sight of it. i estimate the distance it apparently travelled during that time to be 5 or 6 miles and its constant speed to be about 300 to 400 miles per hour. that configuration is highly unusual in this area of normal light air traffic and flight patterns are not usually in that direction for aircraft. i ran to the house taking 20 seconds to fetch a good pair of binoculars and ran to where the woods would not obscure my view. i did not see the object again. however it appeared as though there was an airplane travelling northwest (from where the object appeared to be headed) at the expected (much slower) normal rate of speed with the usual flashing lights. (i have pilot experience so i consider myself to be a good judge of observance). i am a fairly avid reader of ufo phenominon however this is the first time i have ever witnessed anything out of the ordinary in this realm. i would never make a bogus claim and am confident of my observational skills. i was surprised at what i saw and felt a little excited when i went to get my binoculars. (i always keep them hanging near the door in the event an airplane flies nearby). i am cautious not to claim the object to be a classic ufo for the lack of blatently obvious unusual characteristics they are reputed to exhibit. the most compelling factors were the high speed, silence and to a lesser degree the bright light. (i realize, depending on atmospheric factors, that aircraft lights can appear to be rather bright at times). factoring in the vagaries of nightime observation and perception, at most, i would only go so far to call what i observed to be an "unusual peculiarity". i wish it could be run by me one more time for a more conciencious consideration. unfortunately, my attention to the episode was not completely piqued until the event was half over when i suddenly realized what i might be seeing. i was left scratching my head wishing i had intensified my observational effort from the moment i first saw it.
